sen.j: 浦上春琴（うらがみ しゅんきん、安永8年（1779年） - 弘化3年5月23日 (旧暦)（1846年6月16日））は、江戸時代後期の日本の文人画。
sen.e: Shunkin URAGAMI (1779 - June 16, 1846) was a Japanese literati painter in the late Edo period.
Shunkin URAGAMI (1779 - June 16, 1846) was a Japanese literati painter who lived during the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 江戸時代後期の→who lived during the late Edo period
sen.e: Shunkin URAGAMI (1779 - June 16, 1846) was a Japanese literati painter who lived during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 当時、鴨方藩士だった浦上玉堂の長子として備前国（現岡山県）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Bizen Province (present Okayama Prefecture) as the first son of Gyokudo URAGAMI who was a feudal retainer of Kamogata Domain at that time.
He was born in Bizen Province (present-day Okayama Prefecture) as the first son of Gyokudo URAGAMI who was a feudal retainer of the Kamogata clan at that time.
sen.cmt: 鴨方藩士→a feudal retainer of the Kamogata clan
sen.e: He was born in Bizen Province (present-day Okayama Prefecture) as the first son of Gyokudo URAGAMI who was a feudal retainer of the Kamogata clan at that time.

sen.j: 浦上秋琴は実弟。
sen.e: Shukin URAGAMI was his own younger brother.
sen.cmt: 「秋琴」の読みは、下記サイトから引用しました。http://www.general-museum.fks.ed.jp/01_exhibit/teima_tenji/2003/gyokudou/rekibi_2003_04.html
sen.e: His own younger brother was Shukin URAGAMI.
sen.cmt: 「浦上春琴」に関する項目なので、「実弟は～である」の英訳に変更しました。
sen.e: His own younger brother was Shukin URAGAMI.

sen.j: 諱は選、字を伯挙・十千、号 (称号)は春琴のほかに睡菴・文鏡亭・二卿。
sen.e: Imina (personal name) was Sen, Azana (popular name) were Hakukyo and Jussen, and the second names were Shunkin and others like Suian, Bunkyotei and Nikyo.
sen.cmt: 各号の読みは、下記サイトから引用しました。http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji/2ugsk001.html
sen.e: While he was given the names Suian, Bunkyotei and Nikyo as his go (second name or alias) besides Shunkin, his real name was Sen and his nickname was Hakukyo and Jussen.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: While he was given the names Suian, Bunkyotei and Nikyo as his go (second name or alias) besides Shunkin, his real name was Sen and his nickname was Hakukyo and Jussen.

sen.j: 通称は紀一郎もしくは喜一郎。
sen.e: His common name was Kiichiro or Kiichiro.
He was commonly called Kiichiro which can be written as '紀一郎' or '喜一郎.'
sen.cmt: 通称→commonly called「きいちろう」の漢字表記の違いについての記述なので、漢字表記にしました。
sen.e: He was commonly called Kiichiro which can be written as '紀一郎' or '喜一郎.'

sen.j: 戦国大名浦上氏の末裔という。
sen.e: He is said to have been a descendant of the Uragami clan, a warring lord in the Sengoku period.
It is said that he was a descendant of the Uragami clan, Sengoku daimy (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period).
sen.cmt: 戦国大名→Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period)（用語集に合わせました。）
sen.e: It is said that he was a descendant of the Uragami clan, Sengoku daimy (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period).

sen.j: 幼少の頃より父浦上玉堂より書画の手ほどきを受ける。
sen.e: He learned the basics of calligraphic works and paintings from his father Gyokudo URAGAMI from his childhood.
He learned the basics of calligraphic works and paintings from his father, Gyokudo URAGAMI, from his childhood.
sen.cmt: Gyokudo URAGAMIの前後にカンマを付けました。
sen.e: He learned the basics of calligraphic works and paintings from his father, Gyokudo URAGAMI, from his childhood.

sen.j: 寛政4年（1792年）ころより如意道人によって父玉堂とともに春琴の作品が買い上げられている（如意道人蒐集書画帖）。
sen.e: From around 1792, Shunkin's works started being purchased by Nyoidojin with the works of his father Gyokudo (Nyoidojin Shushu Shogajo (Nyoidojin collection of calligraphic works and paintings)).
In around 1792, Nyoidojin started buying Shunkin's works along with the works of his father, Gyokudo (Nyoidojin Shushu Shogajo (Nyoidojin collection of calligraphic works and paintings)).
sen.cmt: 原文通りに「春琴の作品」を主語にするより、「如意道人」を主語にした方が簡潔となるので、変更しました。
sen.e: In around 1792, Nyoidojin started buying Shunkin's works along with the works of his father, Gyokudo (Nyoidojin Shushu Shogajo (Nyoidojin collection of calligraphic works and paintings)).

sen.j: 14歳のころ母が死去。
sen.e: At the age of 14, his mother died.
When he was 14 years old, his mother died.
sen.cmt: 初訳では、「母が14歳で死去」と解釈されるので、変更しました。
sen.e: When he was 14 years old, his mother died.

sen.j: 寛政6年（1794年）父玉堂が脱藩。
sen.e: In 1794, his father Gyokudo deserted the Domain.
In 1794, his father, Gyokudo, left the domain.
In 1794, his father, Gyokudo, left the domain.

sen.j: 父子で諸国を歴遊する。
sen.e: The father and son travelled about various Provinces.
He travelled around various districts with his father.
sen.cmt: 「春琴」を主語とし（"He")、「父と一緒に歴遊する」の方がわかりやすいと判断しました。諸国→various districts
sen.e: He travelled around various districts with his father.

sen.j: 江戸、長崎では画塾に通い古書画を研鑽する。
sen.e: In Edo and Nagasaki, he attended painting schools where he studied old calligraphic works and paintings.
In Edo and Nagasaki, he studied old calligraphic works and paintings at painting schools.
sen.cmt: 画塾に通い→at painting schools（「画塾に通い」は、「画塾で」の意味なので、"at"を使い、簡潔な表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: In Edo and Nagasaki, he studied old calligraphic works and paintings at painting schools.

sen.j: 遊歴を終え20代で京都に定住し、頼山陽や田能村竹田、岡田米山人、岡田半江、篠崎小竹、貫名海屋、柏木如亭ら著名な文人との交わりを深める。
sen.e: After he finished travelling, he settled down in Kyoto in his twenties and grew closer to the well-known literati including Sanyo RAI, Chikuden TANOMURA, Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shochiku SHINOZAKI, Kaioku NUKINA and Jotei KASHIWAGI.
sen.cmt: 人名の読みは下記サイトから引用しました。「岡田米山人」http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%A1%E7%94%B0%E7%B1%B3%E5%B1%B1%E4%BA%BA 「岡田半江」http://fine-vn.com/cat_13/ent_71.html「貫名海屋」http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/149388/m0u/%E3%81%AC%E3%81%8D/ 「柏木如亭」http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9F%8F%E6%9C%A8%E5%A6%82%E4%BA%AD
sen.e: After he finished travelling, he settled down in Kyoto in his twenties and deepened exchanges with best-known literati including Sanyo RAI, Chikuden TANOMURA, Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shochiku SHINOZAKI, Kaioku NUKINA, Jotei KASHIWAGI and so on.
sen.cmt: 著名な→best-known（用語集に合わせました。）～との交わりを深める→deepen exchanges with ～（一般的な表現に変更しました。）柏木如亭ら→Jotei KASHIWAGI and so on（～ら、とあるので、and so onを付けました。）
sen.e: After he finished travelling, he settled down in Kyoto in his twenties and deepened exchanges with best-known literati including Sanyo RAI, Chikuden TANOMURA, Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shochiku SHINOZAKI, Kaioku NUKINA, Jotei KASHIWAGI and so on.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)8年（1811年）藤木氏瀧と結婚。
sen.e: In 1811, he married Ujitaki Fujiki.
In 1811, he married Taki of the Fujiki clan.
sen.cmt: 藤木氏瀧→Taki of the Fujiki clan（やはり、サイトで見当たりませんでしたが、当時の女性の名前は、一字が多かったので、「藤木氏の瀧」と解釈しました。）
sen.e: In 1811, he married Taki of the Fujiki clan.

sen.j: 文化10年（1813年）父玉堂と同居（柳馬場二条北）し夫婦で世話をする。
sen.e: In 1813, he and his wife started living with his father Gyokudo (Yanaginobanba Nijo Kita), of whom the couple looked after.
In 1813, he and his wife moved in a house (Yanaginobanba Nijo Kita) to live with his father, Gyokudo, and looked after him.
sen.cmt: 「夫婦」が主語となっているので、"of the whom the couple"を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1813, he and his wife moved in a house (Yanaginobanba Nijo Kita) to live with his father, Gyokudo, and looked after him.

sen.j: 文政3年（1820年）玉堂歿。
sen.e: In 1820, Gyokudo died.
In 1820, Gyokudo died.
In 1820, Gyokudo died.

sen.j: 山水画、花鳥画に優れ精彩で巧みでありながら透き通るような気品のある作風であった。
sen.e: He was excellent in Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting) and Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) which were vivid and skillful but clear in refined style.
He was excellent in Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting) and Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds), and his style was not only vivid and skillful but also well-refined.
sen.cmt: 「作風が、精彩で巧みでありながら透き通るような気品がある」ので、「山水画」「花鳥画」が関係代名詞の主語とはなりません。
sen.e: He was excellent in Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting) and Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds), and his style was not only vivid and skillful but also well-refined.

sen.j: 中林竹洞や山本梅逸らと名声を競った。
sen.e: He competed in fame with rivals including Chikuto NAKABAYASHI and Baiitsu YAMAMOTO.
He competed in obtaining fame with other painters including Chikuto NAKABAYASHI and Baiitsu YAMAMOTO.
sen.cmt: 名声を競う→compete in obtaining fame（「名声を得るのを競う」の意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: He competed in obtaining fame with other painters including Chikuto NAKABAYASHI and Baiitsu YAMAMOTO.

sen.j: 当時は父玉堂の作品よりよく売れたという。
sen.e: His works were sold more than the works of his father Gyokudo in those days.
It is said that his works were sold more than the works of his father, Gyokudo, at that time.
sen.cmt: 「～という」が訳抜けでしたので、"It is said that"を付け加えました。
sen.e: It is said that his works were sold more than the works of his father, Gyokudo, at that time.

sen.j: また書道・漢詩・平家物語平曲・古琴に優れ、器物、書画の鑑定にも秀でていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, he was good at Shodo (calligraphy), Chinese-style poems, Heikyoku (the music played on Heike Biwa as accompaniment for the recitation of Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)) and Kokin and excellent in making an estimate of the value of utensils and calligraphic works and paintings.

Furthermore, he was also excellent in Shodo (calligraphy), Chinese-style poems, Heike Monogatari Heikyoku (the music played on Heike Biwa as accompaniment for the recitation of Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)) and Kokin (fretless seven-stringed zither), and also showed excellence in appraisal of utensils, and calligraphic works and paintings.
sen.cmt: 古琴→Kokin (fretless seven-stringed zither)（説明の英訳を補足しました。）～の鑑定→appraisal of ～（簡潔な表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: Furthermore, he was also excellent in Shodo (calligraphy), Chinese-style poems, Heike Monogatari Heikyoku (the music played on Heike Biwa as accompaniment for the recitation of Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)) and Kokin (fretless seven-stringed zither), and also showed excellence in appraisal of utensils, and calligraphic works and paintings.

sen.j: 紀春琴の名で画論『論画詩』を著している。
sen.e: He wrote a theory of painting, "Rongashi" under the name of KI no Shunkin.
He wrote a book about theory of painting named "Rongashi" under the name of KI no Shunkin.
sen.cmt: 「画論を著す」は、「画論に関する本を書く」の意味なので、book about theory of paintingとしました。
sen.e: He wrote a book about theory of painting named "Rongashi" under the name of KI no Shunkin.

sen.j: 弘化3年5月歿、享年68。
sen.e: In May 1846, he died at the age of 68.
sen.cmt: 「弘化3年5月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1846年5月25日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: In June 1846, he died at the age of 68.
sen.cmt: 弘化3年5月→June 1846（上記において没年月日が弘化3年5月23日（1846年6月16日）と記載されているので、June 1846に変更しました。）
sen.e: In June 1846, he died at the age of 68.

tit.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました。

Gyokudo Shichijussai Juzo' (Portrait of Gyokudo at the age of 70) (1814) owned by the Hayashibara Museum of Art
sen.cmt: 蔵→owned by文頭のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Gyokudo Shichijussai Juzo' (Portrait of Gyokudo at the age of 70) (1814) owned by the Hayashibara Museum of Art

Kacho-zu' (flowers and birds) (1837) owned by Tokyo University of the Arts

sen.e: Kacho-zu' (flowers and birds) (1837) owned by Tokyo University of the Arts

sen.e: 'Kaki Kaso Zukan' (1844) (Picture book of flowering plants, fruits and vegetables) in the possession of the Kyoto National Museum
Kaki Kaso Zukan' (Picture book of flowering plants, fruits and vegetables) (1844) owned by the Kyoto National Museum
